title: Electric potential energy - sphere and particle

content.question: The particle of charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> is initially located a distance <math alttext="2 R sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math> from the center of the sphere and then moved to the sphere’s center. Which of the following correctly describes the change in the electric potential energy of the particle-sphere system, <math alttext="delta U sub P S, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>PS</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, when the particle is moved, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta U sub P S, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>PS</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. The electric field due to the sphere’s charge does positive work on the positively charged particle.

<math alttext="delta U sub P S, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>PS</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. The motion of the positively charged particle is opposite to the direction of the electric field due to the sphere’s charge.

<math alttext="delta U sub P S, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>PS</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. The electric field due to the sphere’s charge is zero at the center of the sphere.

<math alttext="delta U sub P S, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>PS</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. As the positively charged particle is moved, positive work done outside the sphere is canceled by negative work of equal magnitude that is done inside the sphere.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta U sub P S, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>PS</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. The motion of the positively charged particle is opposite to the direction of the electric field due to the sphere’s charge.
